issue.title: Laser and stereo data misalignment (unrelated to diff between visual and collision geom)

content.raw:
I can confirm this. LIDAR points seem to have a mean range that is 6-10cm closer (varies) to the sensor than it actually should be. I'm attaching two screenshots, one with the robot looking down at the ground with stereo correctly showing the ground plane at a mean height of ~0cm while lidar (red points) measures a height of ~10cm, and the other showing the measurement offset using a dumpster placed in front of the robot:

Attaching failed so here they are:

* http://i.imgur.com/0AWKs5l.png
* http://i.imgur.com/s5DG46B.png
